headline: Hillshire Farm Sausage Alfredo
description: This creamy sausage Alfredo pasta dish gets flavor from Cajun seasoning and smoked sausage. It's an easy dinner that's ready in about 15 minutes.

video.description: See how to put a tasty twist on a classic alfredo pasta.
video.name: Smoked Sausage Alfredo

name: Hillshire Farm Sausage Alfredo
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) package Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage, diagonally cut into 1/4-inch slices

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes depending on shape and package directions; drain and set aside.
While pasta is cooking, sauté sausage in a large skillet over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, turning occasionally.
Add cream and Cajun seasoning; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer gently until mixture begins to thicken, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan cheese.
Add pasta to sauce and toss to serve.

review.reviewBody: Doubled the amount of noodles when using linguine noodles and used some cajun two step fire seasoning along with 2 tablespoons of hot sauce. Love this recipe!
My family loves this, and its fast and easy!
My husband liked it. I thought it was ok. If I make it again, I think I will use Alfredo sauce instead of heavy cream.
Easy and delicious
Quick, easy and delicious!!
It was a bit bland for us, will try again but will add some other spices
I made this recipe exactly as it is stated. This a great recipe. My family and I love it!
This is a delicious meal!

This was a super hit with my family. I doubled the base recipe. I used Eckrich smoked sausage fried in 2tbsp of olive oil. I also diced up 1 red bell pepper, 1 yellow bell pepper, 1/2 of a green bell pepper, and sliced 1 qt of red grape tomatoes in half tossed them with 2tbsp of olive oil some crushed black pepper and Italian seasoning, and roasted them in the oven while I was cooking the sausage and sauce. I added the toasted vegetables right after I stirred in the parmesan. It added so much flavor and was just delicious.
Delicious! I added peas and some bell peppers. Would make again.

Wow what as recipe. I did not use hillshire farm sausage I used another brand but boy was it good. I have to double or triple all the recipes I make because if have three teenage boys. They usually have seconds but this time they had thirds. I used grape tomatoes because that is what I had but I think they went over better that a diced tomato would have.
very good recipe, I added a 1/2 teaspoon of red pepper flakes.
This dish was great just as given! Thank you for sharing and this has become one of my families favorites. So nice to have a recipe with few ingredients and so quick to make.
So easy and everyone (including kids) loves it. fast and perfect for school nights.
Easy to fix and delicious

The picky little ones loved it, so it's definitely a keeper. I added in a bit of onion, garlic, and thyme while I was browning the sausage. I used bowtie pasta and added in some broccoli for a bit of color. It was delicious, and now I'm wondering how it'll taste with a bit of bacon added.

This was so easy and quick to make. I did add garlic and onion. I sautéed them with the smoked sausage and added about 1/2 cup frozen peas. Everyone loved it! Definitely going into my favorite recipes!!
I love Alfredo and i love adding spices that kick up my food to the next level. This recipe combines two things i love. This dish is irresistible and makes you just want that second helping
Delicious, easy recipe!
Made as directed in recipe. Turned out very nice. Will definitely make this again.

I just finished making this dish!! OMG!! It is delicious!! I uploaded a pic of it, of course, not as pic perfect as the original post, but it's perfect for me.
 So, here are my changes: I added peas & carrots to the dish. I believe some Reviews mentioned the peas but I had a bag of peas & carrots. It gave it some color. The other change was: I didn't have Cajun Seasoning (I have tried locating it in the stores but I guess it's a popular seasoning around here) so, I looked up ingredients that go into making the seasoning, threw it in a ziploc bag & mixed it all well. This dish came out TERRIFIC!! Hubby loves it & he said it's a KEEPER!!

I made one major change, instead of Parmesan cheese I used Gruyere cheese because it melts faster and more consistently. 
 Everyone loved it and there were no left overs. I will make it again and again. So simple..
We love this! I add in 2 red bell peppers, sauteed in olive oil to soften them up. Then I add some cayenne pepper to give it a little kick.

I made this dish today and it was so easy, so quick and sooooo good! I used Hillshire Roasted Garlic Smoked Chicken. I didn't have Cajun seasoning so I substituted a little Cayenne pepper instead . This is definitely is a main dish you can whip up so easily in a flash and will totally impress...
I cook for picky eaters and everyone LOVED IT!
Easiest recipe and so tasty

This recipe was delicious! It was creamy, a little spicy, and pretty filling! I used tri-color rigatoni for the pasta, which brightened up the dish. I did have some trouble getting the sauce to thicken, but because I was using extra pasta a lot of it was soaked up. I would suggest using extra pasta or maybe cutting back on the heavy cream. This recipe is definitely going to become a regular!
Added more cheese and cajun seasoning

I will use cajun sausage next time. 
This is something my 15 year old can make if I'm running late.
Delicious. And easy.
It was good. I added red peper flakes and corn and broccoli. i think the only thing i would change is, a roux for the sauce first.
I saute chopped bell peppers and onions with the sausage and when ready for serving I stir in chopped tomatoes. my coworkers requests this dish at every pot luck.

The amount of pasta in the recipe is only 8 ounces which is only enough pasta for 2 people. I added a lot more pasta and substituted smoke sausage for Hillshire Polish Kielbasa sausage. The dish turned out really yummy. More than enough for a family of 3!

I’ve made this 3 times. After the first time it quickly went into our weekly rotation. 6 picky kids, busy sports schedules. This was easy, fast and delicious. Lots of flavor. I did add a bit of minced garlic, but changed nothing else.

I have made this quite a few times for my family and it is always a hit, even the second day. One of the best quick and easy recipes I have tried on this site. I would not change a thing. I did use a homemade Cajun seasoning recipe from this site as well.
My teens love this which is rare , i do bow tie pasta and add some corn, make this dish weekly by request and amazing every time ;)
I didn't have heavy cream so we used a jar of Alfredo Sauce.
Family loved it. We making it a lot.

I wanted to do something different with this. Used a beef sausage and used whole milk instead of heavy cream. I browned meat, added flour to the grease and let it thicken. I put the milk and Cajun seasoning in and let it cook and combine. I let it cool some then added about a cup of fire roasted tomatoes and a tablespoon of tomato paste (the cooling was to prevent curdling). I added shredded parmesan and it was delicious!
Good but the recipe doesn't call for any veggies, the pic appears to have some. IMO this needs some greens to help with the texture and color.

Would have given it a five star but I change it do to time. With my husband and get back before me after a 14 hours work shift I knew it had to be ready when he walked in. I premade the noodles but them in the refrigerator, but a jar of sauce plus everything else in a 2 quart slow cooker and had it on low for four hours. It came out great.

The whole family really liked this. I followed the suggestion from other reviews and added a cup of frozen peas when I added the cream and spices to the mixture. I also added 1 clove of minced garlic as well to help round out and enhance the flavor. Definitely will make this again.
Tasty!
Since I'm lazy, I bought prepared Alfredo sauce to use on one of the occasions that I made this. I also added shrimp and doubled the amount of Cajun spice suggested. It was still a hit!
Very good. Made as directed. Needs a little salt but very good.
This is my boys' favorite meal. I don't change anything. I use bowtie past or rotini.
Big hit with the teenagers

This was a super easy. Even with adding broccoli, red, yellow, orange peppers, chicken and shrimp it was quick. I also added chicken and shrimp for some added variety. This will be a household meal. My family loved it!
Turned out great !
We really enjoyed this. Easy to prepare. Next time I might add some mushrooms and roasted red pepper, but still great as is.

Great recipe exactly as is written. I have added it to my repertoire. Nice heat without going overboard.
I really like spice so I also tried making it with hot Italian sausage which turned out well.

After making this many times I began getting tired of keeping heavy cream on hand. A can of evaporated milk substitutes very well and is easier to keep on hand.
A family favorite!
Rich and creamy! Switch it up by swapping the cajun seasoning for italian. So good!
I make this all the time. I do not make any changes and it’s so delicious and easy to make!!
I used 12 oz of penne and the sauce was perfect. Not runny at all. I also used shredded Parmesan instead of grated. So GOOD!!

Fyi dont mix up teaspoons and tablespoons....big flavor difference....I was about to chalk it up to a new flavor recipe but it was my fault for reading incorrectly. Also did angel hair pasta turned out great other than too salty from too much seasoning.
Very good, I added onions and garlic when browning the sausage.

The sauce isn’t quite as thick as I would like it, but I think I can thicken it up next time I make this dish. It’s quick, easy and tastes delicious. I’ll definitely be making this dish more again. I think I’ll try adding some bacon bits in with it next time too.

This was fantastic. I did change up a few things. I added fresh onions and peppers to the pan before cooking the sausage. I also put this all to the side before I made the sauce in the pan. In addition to the cream I added half a cup of milk. It was a huge hit with the whole family. This will definitely be added to the request list!
So yummy. Used all beef sausage and it was still good!
The only problem that I had with this recipe is that there wasn't enough for my family. I'll have to double it next time. One other problem was that it was really salty.
Will make it again!
AMAZING!!! My husband and I couldn’t believe how quick and easy it was, but yet so delicious!! It’s our new favorite dish!!
Finally a pasta dish that EVERYONE loved! Simple, easy, and customizable!
Made no change, will make it again
One of my favorite recipes! We are not big spicy food lovers so I used garlic and a little bit of black pepper instead. The whole family loved it! :))
This is so easy and the kids always love it!
i have made this a lot the only thing i do is add a little butter for the Alfredo sauce and use different pastas each time i like it with bowties
It was easy to make. I think I might try this with shrimp or chicken. I only had spiral pasta, which I loved instead of the penne.
Add this to your list of fast and easy delicious cheap meals. Added fresh tomatoes and jalapeños to freshen it up! Would be great will bell peppers added.
I basically followed the recipe and I added shrimp. Delicious!!! I will definitely make this again and again and again!!
Very delicious and comforting.. will be making again!!
easy and delicious!

I modify the sauce... First I cook minced garlic with a little butter on med heat. Then add the cream, cajun seasoning, parsley flakes and cook for about 5 min. And then I mix it all up in a pot with the already cooked pasta and the already browned sausage. 6 out of 6 people in the family LOVE it. I also add shrimp to it if I have it.
I thought it was delicious. Based on what another reviewer said, I only used 1.5 cups of cream and that was perfect. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly. Would definitely make again.

This was amazing. Couple things I did differently. Used a turkey sausage not Jenny o brand. Less sodium not using Jenny o. Added shrimp cooked. And at the end when mixing the cheese I had a 2 teaspoons of crushed red pepper because I like a little more kick. Mixed in the ingredients, let it rest for 3-4 mins and put on the organic green onion and diced tomatoes to finish for color and flavor. Wife and I love it. We will probably do it again.

I pulled this recipe for a night we had numerous sport obligations. My 14 year old cooked it and could not stop raving about how easy it was to make and how tasty! There were no leftovers! We will definitely make this again.
TEN STARS hands down!!! This recipe is delicious and super easy to whip up. My family absolutely loves it. I have made this about 100 times now and there are still no leftovers when I make it.
Fast, easy, and good!

I doubled the recipe to feed our family and everybody really liked it. I didn't have Cajun seasoning - so I used Tony Chackere's Creole seasoning. I would have liked more liquid... but the pasta inhaled it.

Made this for my family of 6 tonight and we loved it! As a mom of four, quick and easy dinners is a must and this was definitely both of those. I did cut back the Cajun seasoning a bit due to my kids not liking a lot of heat. This is definitely a dish I will be making again and again.
I added peas, minced garlic and onion to it. It was wonderful but a little bland.
Enjoyed this, very nice and quick. Added peas this time
This dish was a family favorite, everyone (kids and adults) enjoyed this flavorful and easy to make dish!!! I would 10/10 recommend this to a friend
I didn’t have Cajun seasoning so I used 1/2 tsp cayenne and 1/2 tsp paprika. Just enough heat but not too spicy for the kids. Amazing meal. Will definitely make again.
I made my own Cajun seasoning. I added the peas and green onions. Was really good. My husband said to add it to the list to make again. Very filling. Had a tiny tiny kick tot he taste buds.
easy I doubled it it's going into my meal rotation. Made it again today but I cheated I used Alfredo sauce instead on heavy cream

I couldn't quite find the recipe I was looking for, but thought this one had promise to use as a base recipe for the ingredients I wanted to use. I added a small amount of oil (less than 1 Tbsp) to the skillet and put in a chopped pepper along with the sausage slices so those could cook together. After those were ready I turned the heat down and added broccoli, put on the lid and let it heat (I used frozen because I didn't have time to use the fresh I had on hand - either one would work.) Instead of just plain pasta, I used 1 1/2 containers of cheese tortellini that I cooked separately. After the broccoli was heated. I added the tortellini to the skillet. I made the sauce as stated and added that to the skillet with all the other ingredients and mixed it well. My family and I really enjoyed it.

5 stars with my additions. I removed the browned sausage and added onions, minced garlic, frozen peas, and fresh mushrooms to the pan drippings and cooked the vegetables through. Then made the sauce as directed and added the sausage and pasta. I don't buy special spices like Cajun spice, mainly due to the excessive salt in them. I used the Cajun spice mix recipe on this site and scaled it down to yield the 2 t. needed for this recipe. My husband and I love things hot and spicy so I added a bit more cayenne. I used bow tie pasta...cute and tasty!
Super good! My husband loved it. And it was SO easy and quick.
Very Delicious My Husband And My Cousins Loved it!
I also used a little beef or chicken broth with the heavy cream and parmesan cheese. It is good with Julian style red, green, and yellow peppers sautéed in it too!

Absolutely delicious! 
I added a little extra cheese. (:
super easy and super fast. I took one of the reviewer's advice and added a clove of garlic, some butter, and onion to the sauce. love it.
I added shrimp, chicken, spinach, garlic, bell pepper and onion. So so so sooooo good!

This was the easiest, yummiest recipe EVER! I used a different type of sausage, added tomatoes, bell peppers and garlic but still followed the directions as listed. I’ll be making this twice a month lol. Thank you!

My family loves this! I actually made a little more pasta and added cut fresh asparagus to the pasta when it was boiling. I also added a little more parmesan cheese to thicken the sauce a bit more. Delish! Will definitely be making this again!

I made this recipe as directed but as the comments suggested I added some peas ,I also added some asparagus and garlic and onion. I will Definitely be keeping this quick and easy recipe in my favorites

Added thinly sliced green pepper. 
used 1% milk mixed w/flour and 3 tbsp butter instead of heavey cream.

Turned out beautiful and delish!
Quick and to the point. I like the suggestion to add edamame
